normalised: Lights, camera, and lots of chai! Film festival season is officially upon us, folks! From the bustling streets of Mumbai to the serene hills of Shimla, cinephiles are in for a treat. The excitement is palpable as film festivals are showcasing everything from groundbreaking indie flicks to big-budget Bollywood extravaganzas. Heard whispers that Anurag Kashyap’s new project might just premiere at the M A M I Film Festival this year! Imagine the rush! These festivals aren't just about movies; they're a celebration of storytelling, art, and, let's be honest, a whole lot of samosas. Remember catching that Malayalam gem at the I F F K in Kerala last year? Absolutely stunning! This year's lineup promises to be just as diverse, maybe even with a special screening during Onam festivities. Plus, word on the street is that there’s a panel discussion on regional cinema attracting filmmakers from across India, all vying for that coveted "Golden Lotus" award. So grab your popcorn (or biryani, depending on your mood) and settle in. It's going to be a cinematic rollercoaster ride! Don't forget to book your tickets, they're selling faster than hot jalebis on a cold Delhi evening!
